body.p: Those Board members also believe that the amendments are flawed by offering entities a choice of presentation methods. The Board has expressed a desire to reduce alternatives in IFRSs. The Preface to International Financial Reporting Standards, in paragraph 13, states: ‘the IASB intends not to permit choices in accounting treatment ... and will continue to reconsider … those transactions and events for which IASs permit a choice of accounting treatment, with the objective of reducing the number of those choices.’ The Preface extends this objective to both accounting and reporting. The same paragraph states: ‘The IASB’s objective is to require like transactions and events to be accounted for and reported in a like way and unlike transactions and events to be accounted for and reported differently’ (emphasis added). By permitting a choice in this instance, the IASB has abandoned that principle.
